message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY

This paper deals with measuring stylistic coordination in dialogues, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The proposed measure is based on information theory, which is a common tool used in machine learning and data analysis, suggesting that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of statistical learning (cs.SI). The paper also discusses confounding factors and proposes tests to distinguish correlations due to contextual factors and turn-by-turn coordination, which are topics that fall under the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and cybernetics (cs.CY).
